Detailed Description

During code generatin we'd like to know what information needs to be emitted in the global data section for objects such as globally defined variables and string literals which is that this class handles. During parsing any globally declared variables will be added whereas string literals aren't added until MIR lowering time when their useage is replaced with references.

The information added during parsing and MIR lowering is output at the beginning of code generation. Rather than provide methods to retrieve the info, we allow the provision of a file handle which we then use to output the .data and .bss sections ourselves.

string CGlobalDataStore::GetStrLitRefNo ( const string &  Lit  ) 

Determine if the literal Lit already exists to perform a simple form of string pooling by returning a reference to a previously added literal if the new literal matches any.

Parameters:
Lit String literal value to check against those already added.
Returns:
Reference to a previously added string literal if a match is already present or a new reference name if there isn't one.

string CGlobalDataStore::GetFpLitRefNo ( const string &  Lit  ) 

Get the next reference number for referring to a floating point literal.

Parameters:
Lit The value of the literal.
Returns:
A reference name to the literal.

Field Documentation

map<string, string> CGlobalDataStore::m_StrLiterals [private]

All string literals we're holding onto, the key is the reference number used in the IR and the value is the literal itself.

map<string, string> CGlobalDataStore::m_FpLiterals [private]

List of floating point literals in the program.
